content.raw: that is a good question: as we maintained several branches, sometimes we have two different backports (or one commit and a backport) into several branches. This can lead to situations where you have a commit done in gazebo 4.1 but it was not merged forward into gazebo5 branch. In case of doubt, I feel like providing more information (even if it could be a duplicate) can not hurt users and really helps the people looking for an specific patch (like the one here with GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH).
content.html: that is a good question: as we maintained several branches, sometimes we have two different backports (or one commit and a backport) into several branches. This can lead to situations where you have a commit done in gazebo 4.1 but it was not merged forward into gazebo5 branch. In case of doubt, I feel like providing more information (even if it could be a duplicate) can not hurt users and really helps the people looking for an specific patch (like the one here with GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH).
